intro: Endlicheria grandis, commonly known as the giant endlicheria, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter, typically in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Endlicheria grandis is adapted to cool, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or mountainous terrain.
